description.narrative: Adolescent migrants and refugees have skills for learning and employability and are empowered to voice their opinions, which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Skills Development, Skills Development (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: ALL MIGRANT AND REFUGEE CHILDREN , UASC or with their families, benefit from timely, equitable, quality access to services to guarantee their protection, care, development and social inclusion in ITALY (2018-2019)

participating-org.narrative: CNR ISTITUTO PER LE TECNOLOGIE DIDATTICHE

sector.narrative: Ending violence against women and girls

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Adolescent migrants and refugees have skills for learning and employability and are empowered to voice their opinions

description.narrative: In partnership with the Italian Ombudspersons for Children and Adolescents, with Regional Education Offices, Social Services, and the private sector at the municipal and regional levels, during 2019 UNICEF continued support to the social inclusion of refugee and migrant adolescents providing around 1,136 adolescent migrants and refugees with skills building opportunities and reaching more than 3,200 with the U-Report on the Move. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2020
